hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric Volatility Expansion on Negative vs. Positive News
hypothesis_content.statement: In the current NEUTRAL regime, the absolute magnitude of BTC's 1-hour price move following NEGATIVE surprise macro news will be 40-60% greater than the move following a POSITIVE surprise of similar magnitude, indicating market asymmetry favoring downside amplification.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market psychology in uncertain environments exhibits 'loss aversion' - negative news carries more weight. Recent headlines emphasize downside risks ('much scarier macro catalyst', 'more downside possible'), suggesting a heightened sensitivity to bad news. This creates a built-in asymmetry.
entry_conditions: Major US macro release (NFP, CPI) deviates from consensus forecast by >1 standard deviation
If deviation is NEGATIVE (weaker jobs/higher inflation): Enter short on 5-min confirmation candle close below open
If deviation is POSITIVE: Enter long on 5-min confirmation candle close above open

exit_conditions.take_profit: For SHORT: Move equal to (1.5 * average 1hr move of last 5 positive surprise reactions). For LONG: Move equal to (1.0 * average 1hr move of last 5 positive surprise reactions).
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses beyond the midpoint of the initial 15-minute range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Over 10 consecutive catalyst events, the ratio of negative-catalyst moves to positive-catalyst moves averages below 1.2, indicating no significant asymmetry.
